name: places/ChIJ2XHVQhv0wokRZlQjuL00EZc
formattedAddress: 1600 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10040, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1600 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10040-3395, USA

originalText.text:
I have refused to go to big pharmacies like cvs and Walgreens bc I've always thought it to be better to support mom and pop shops.

But (idk why) this is the 2nd time I get my meds from them and they feel significantly less effective, which means they are either storing it at the wrong temperature or light exposure, which says alot about their quality control.

Also and this is the more annoying part, online they say they close at 7 but they close at 6, I called at 6:09 and passed by at about 6:20 something and it was closed.

Lastly they have 10$min for 1$ co-pays,  which is very unnecessary at the period of time.

They are typically nice in service, that part I'd give 4 stars, but the other things like respect of time, and quality matter so much more when it comes to a pharmacy.

originalText.text:
I was refused a flu shot after being told over phone that I could get one. Seems they dont accept Medicare pt. B. Then I was refused a prescription
after being told on phone I could get it. It had been sent to different pharmacy, not filled there.  I finally called the other pharmacy and they called Asbell to confirm they didnt fill it.  Staff was for most part rude and unhelpful, including the pharmacist/owner.
Store was crowded and not enforcing social distancing.  Worst pharmacy I ever dealt with.

originalText.text: The owner Jay is very knowledgeable and makes me feel very comfortable every time I come in there. Will not try to sell me something that I don't need and never tried to upsell name brands. Very polite!  The staff is very warm and welcoming him as well. What do you speak English Spanish or any other language they treat you exactly the same! The only pharmacy I go to Unless obviously there is an emergency!

originalText.text: I would say these prescriptions in this pharmacy uses very low grade brand and quality. You look at the ingredients on some of the meds compared to a CVS or Duane Reade, they are horrible. Be careful where you get prescribed medicine. Washington Hts on the east side is low income and lots of stores have cheap brand/low quality items in general and many ran through illegal monies. I wouldn mess with medication. This is no judgement on any status, just a reality to be educated on your products, consumption and quality.

originalText.text: I practically grew u with this  small town feel pharmacy. Jay knows me, my mother, brother and  even family members from India! He knows his stuff and truly cares about his clients
